Providence.Moses Brown School: Moses Brown School is a highly selective Quaker school located in Providence, Rhode Island offering pre-kindergarten through secondary school classes. It was founded in 1784 by Moses Brown, a Quaker abolitionist, and is the 8th oldest preparatory school in the country . The school motto is Verum Honorem, (For The Honor of Truth) and the school song is "Beneath the Elms," a reference to the large grove of elm trees that still surrounds the school to this day.
